intro: Aster roxburghii, commonly known as the Chinese aster, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. Aster roxburghii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
